result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 1:27pm 
Defendant Nicholas S Jordan appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD appears for bond purposes only; Mr. Jordan does not qualify for Public Defender representation).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney De La Rosa agrees the Zoom connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given. Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he has provided Mr. Jordan with a blank petition form to request appointment of counsel. 
The Court schedules the case for status-of-counsel hearing; the Court tolls time limits.  
The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no discussion of the case with Victim 2
--no presence at the 1200 Ruth Street address in Watertown
--no presence at the Watertown High School or at any school events
--no presence at the McDonalds in Watertown 
recess 1:32 pm. 

NEXT: Status Conference (status-of-counsel hearing) on April 27th at 1:15pm   [JA, please flag in comments that the case is at AIA stage; prelim time limit was tolled]
